conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D view: walls have height/thickness, multiple faces per wall are visible, and the ceiling/roof is removed to expose interior spaces.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D massing with readable wall thickness and volume; isometric-like camera and clean cutaway. Minor simplification/irregularities at some wall junctions/open edges.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall apartment concept (living/dining core with bedrooms to one side) is similar, but several plan-specific spaces are missing or relocated. Balconies and some service/toilet partitions do not match the 2D plan well, and one bedroom appears omitted.

interior_elements.notes: Living and dining furniture present; kitchen counters present; toilets have basic fixtures. However, fixtures/room assignments are simplified and some rooms from the 2D plan (dress/utility/servant/service spaces) are not faithfully furnished or are absent.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render with distinct walls/floors/openings and good visibility. Minimal artifacts; presentation is uncluttered.

detected_errors.description: At least one bedroom/major room from the 2D plan (4 total bedrooms incl. master) appears missing in the 3D model (only ~3 beds/bedrooms clearly represented).
Balcony placement and several internal partitions (notably dress/utility/service zones and some toilet sublayouts) do not align well with the 2D plan.
Door/window placement and opening sizes appear simplified and are not consistently mapped to the same walls as in the 2D plan.
Furniture/fixtures are simplified and do not fully reflect the room identities and counts implied by the 2D plan (e.g., dress room/service areas).

summary: A valid 3D cutaway conversion with good readability, but only moderate layout fidelity due to missing/relocated rooms (notably a bedroom and balcony/service/dress areas) and simplified openings.
